nodes.name: ReasonLoggingRegistry

nodes.documentation:
@dev Emit this event when a claim is set on the registry.
- issuer The address that issued this claim
- subject Address of the claim recipient (who the claim is about)
- key Claim key (what the claim is about)
- value Claim value (what is being claimed)
- reason Hash of the off chain stored reason information
nodes.name: ClaimSetReason

nodes.documentation:
@dev Emit this event when a claim is removed from the registry.
- issuer The address that has issued this claim
- subject Address of the claim recipient (who the claim is about)
- key Claim key (what the claim is about)
- value Claim value (what is being claimed)
- reason Hash of the off chain stored reason information
nodes.name: ClaimRemovedReason

nodes.documentation:
@dev Emit this event when an authorized claim is set on the registry.
- issuer The address of the administratior making the claim
- subject Address of the claim recipient (who the claim is about)
- key Claim key (what the claim is about)
- value Claim value (what is being claimed)
- reason Hash of the off chain stored reason information
nodes.name: AuthClaimSetReason

nodes.documentation:
@dev Emit this event when an authorized claim is removed from the registry.
- issuer The address of the administrator removing the claim
- subject Address of the claim recipient (who the claim is about)
- key Claim key (what the claim is about)
- value Claim value (what is being claimed)
- reason Hash of the off chain stored reason information

constructor.details: Constructor takes the Guard implementation address and passes it to the base constuctor.

params._guard: The address of the guard implementation.

params._key: Claim key (what the claim is about)
params._subject: Address of the claim recipient (who the claim is about)

getClaim(address,address,bytes32).return: The value of the claim found, or null

isAuthorized(address,bytes4).details: The check performed by calling `canCall` on the Guard instance. If no Guard instance is configured, function returns false (as a failsafe).

params._sig: The function selector of the function being called.

isAuthorized(address,bytes4).return: True, if the caller is authorized to make the call.

getClaim(address,address,bytes32).notice: Get an exisiting claim from the registry.

isAuthorized(address,bytes4).notice: isAuthorized will return `true` if `_src` address can call the function with the `_sig` function selector in the current context (in this contract).

removeAuthClaim(address,bytes32).notice: Removes a claim from the special AUTH_CLAIM_ADDR. This action requires authorization.

removeAuthClaim(address,bytes32,bytes32).notice: Removes a claim from the special AUTH_CLAIM_ADDR. This action requires authorization.

removeClaim(address,address,bytes32).notice: Remove an existing claim from the registry. Claims can only be removed by the `issuer` that has set them.

removeClaim(address,address,bytes32,byte.notice: Remove an existing claim from the registry. Claims can only be removed by the  `issuer` that has previously set them.

setAuthClaim(address,bytes32,bytes32).notice: Sets a claim from the special AUTH_CLAIM_ADDR. This action requires authorization.

setAuthClaim(address,bytes32,bytes32,byt.notice: Sets a claim from the special AUTH_CLAIM_ADDR. This action requires authorization.

setClaim(address,bytes32,bytes32).notice: Set a new claim in the registry.

setClaim(address,bytes32,bytes32,bytes32.notice: Set a new claim in the registry.

setGuard(address).notice: setGuard will set the new Guard instance. The caller must have permissions to call this function in the current Guard instance.

setSelfClaim(bytes32,bytes32).notice: Set a claim with the caller as the `subject` of the claim.

setSelfClaim(bytes32,bytes32,bytes32).notice: Set a claim with the caller as the `subject` of the claim.

userdoc.notice: ReasonLoggingRegistry logs all changes to the registry with a hash of a reason of change.
